summary: This research paper provides a comprehensive understanding of the structure of curve neighborhoods in the odd symplectic Grassmannian, denoted as IG(k, 2n + 1). The authors highlight that previous descriptions of these neighborhoods were limited and utilized in proving a quantum Chevalley rule. In contrast, this study aims to deliver a full account of the irreducible components of these neighborhoods, incorporating advanced mathematical concepts such as Hecke products, Weyl group elements, k-strict partitions, and BC-partitions that adhere to the Bruhat order. Furthermore, the authors align their approach with the philosophical framework established by Buch and Mihalcea in their earlier works on Schubert varieties in homogeneous cases.
